body: Thanks for raising the issue! We'll look into this!

issue.title: Shapedtw feature branch

milestone.title: v0.4.1
milestone.description: Further consolidation of interface, add support for 3d np.arrays

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
## Reference Issues/PRs

PR fixes issue number #284.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented. 
-->

The algorithm that I have implemented here is ShapeDTW which is similar to ordinary DTW except that instead of performing DTW on the original time series, you transform it into a list of arrays or shapelets. DTW is then performed on these list of arrays. This algorithm involved implementing several new transformers - SlidingWindowSegmenter, DerivativeTransformer, DWTTransformer and more. This algorithm did require writing a helper function in TimeSeriesNeighbours so that this module is compatible with multivariate classification (the distance metrics are compatable but the original TimeSeriesNeighbours is not). 

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one? 

Not anymore.


#### PR checklist for new estimators 

- [x] I have added unit tests and made sure they pass locally. 
 
- [ ] I have updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my algorithm works.
   
- [x] I have updated sktime's 
[estimator overview](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/ESTIMATOR_OVERVIEW.md) and I'm
 committed to maintain my contribution and provide bug fixes if necessary.

#### Any other comments?

body: I am interested to have a look, seems like it got something to do with the wrapper decorator.
@Quaterion may I know which version of Sci-Kit learn you are using?
I suspect that this error will occur if using sci-kit learn 0.22 or below. The decorator for check_array was added in 27th April 2020 so was released in 0.23.0rc1 and after

@Cheukting Thanks for offering to work on this! KNN needs some refactoring I believe, the current solution isn't very clean. But check if any changes have been made already in #287. I'd really appreciate a clean up of KNN!
I can have a look, it's quite easy to solve this problem to make it compatible, just need to add check if this function is wrapped.

Creating a PR into our dev branch would be great! 

Ideally, I'd prefer a solution in which we do not temporarily overwrite the `check_array` function which seems really hacky to me. But that might require more refactoring to make it work with sklearn's classes.

> 
> 
> @Quaterion may I know which version of Sci-Kit learn you are using?

It is version '0.22.1'

> Creating a PR into our dev branch would be great!
> 
> Ideally, I'd prefer a solution in which we do not temporarily overwrite the `check_array` function which seems really hacky to me. But that might require more refactoring to make it work with sklearn's classes.

I see the whole issue begins with overriding sci-kit learn's check_array. Give me some time tomorrow and let me see if I can find a solution to that.

issue.title: make knn compatible with sci-kit learn below 0.23

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look at
the extension guidelines: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->
Fixes #289 
#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented. 
-->

Added a workaround for check_array that is not wrapped with a decorator.
Change the _check_array_ts to accept any other not used arguments and keyword arguments.

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one? 

<!--
If your contribution does add a new dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate
 companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum. 
-->
Nope

#### PR checklist for new estimators 
<!--
This is only relevant if you contribute new algorithm or estimator (classifiers, regressors, forecasters, etc
.). If so, please go through the checklist below. Otherwise please ignore check list.

- [ ] I have added unit tests and made sure they pass locally. 
- [ ] I have updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my algorithm works.
- [ ] I have updated sktime's [estimator overview](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/ESTIMATOR_OVERVIEW.md) and I'm committed to maintain my contribution and provide bug fixes if necessary.
-->

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering, convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.

Thanks for contributing!
-->

No test added but it passes all test before. Have tried on examples/02_classification_univariate.ipynb with sci-kit learn 0.22.1 and passes the knn fit.

body: I have made the above PR to patch it. Unfortunately, check_array is used all over the places in sci-kit learn and there is no easy way to remove check_array otherwise. I think having a discussion with the sci-kit learn team to see if adding an extra option to bypass the check would be the best solution.
